div.p: Grupo 1 Mapeamento de Logical Observation Identifiers, Names and Codes (LOINC) to http://athena.ohdsi.org/search-terms/terms

tr.td:
VERIFIED MAPPING via Athena (2025-11-28): - OMOP concept_id: 37547368 - Domain: Measurement - Concept Class: Lab Test - Vocabulary: LOINC - Valid dates: 2020-08-11 to 2099-12-31 - Standard concept: Standard
ETL Implementation: - MEASUREMENT.measurement_concept_id = 37547368 - MEASUREMENT.value_as_number = SDNN value - MEASUREMENT.unit_concept_id = 8587 (millisecond) - MEASUREMENT.measurement_type_concept_id = 44818707 (Patient self-reported)
hrv-rmssd-local (RMSSD - Root Mean Square of Successive Differences [Custom])

CRITICAL GAP: RMSSD has NO OMOP concept (concept_id = 0)
Clinical Importance: - Primary parasympathetic marker (HRV Task Force 1996) - Main HRV metric from consumer wearables (Apple, Oura, Garmin) - Strongly associated with vagal tone and inflammation (RS1 finding) - Mathematical relationship: RMSSD = SD1 × √2 (Poincaré plot)
Workaround: 1. Create local custom concept in OMOP vocabulary with concept_class_id = 'Observable Entity' 2. Map to general HRV concept 37547368 with qualifier (data loss) 3. Store in measurement_source_value field (non-standardized)
Recommendation: Submit new concept proposal to OHDSI Vocabulary team

GAP: pNN50 has no OMOP concept (concept_id = 0)
Clinical notes: - High correlation with RMSSD (r > 0.90) - Parasympathetic marker - Unit: percentage (%) - Normal range: typically 20-30% in healthy adults
ETL workaround: Store as measurement_source_value = 'pNN50:{value}%'
hrv-lf-hf-local (LF/HF Ratio - Low to High Frequency Power Ratio [Custom])

GAP: LF/HF ratio has no OMOP concept (concept_id = 0)
Clinical notes: - Autonomic balance indicator (sympathovagal) - Interpretation is debated in literature - Dimensionless ratio - Typically 1.5-2.0 in healthy adults at rest
ETL workaround: Store in measurement_source_value with qualifier
Verified standard OMOP concept for heart rate. - OMOP concept_id: 3027018 - Unit_concept_id: 8541 (per minute, {beats}/min) - Critical contextual data for HRV interpretation

Maps to general heart rate concept. Resting context can be captured in: - visit_occurrence.visit_concept_id - measurement qualifier - observation_period context
Resting HR is critical for HRV baseline interpretation (Uth formula: VO2max = HRmax/HRrest × 15)

div.p: Grupo 2 Mapeamento de SNOMED CT (all versions) to http://athena.ohdsi.org/search-terms/terms

tr.td: Critical for HRV interpretation. RSA (respiratory sinus arrhythmia) affects HF power band.

title.value: HRV LOINC to OMOP CDM Mapping

description.value:
Maps HRV (Heart Rate Variability) metrics from LOINC codes to OMOP CDM concepts for federated analytics.
Key Findings from RS4 Systematic Review (354 papers analyzed): - ZERO documented HRV-OMOP transformations in peer-reviewed literature - Only ONE OMOP concept available: 37547368 (SDNN via LOINC 80404-7) - CRITICAL GAP: RMSSD, pNN50, LF/HF have NO OMOP concepts (concept_id = 0)
This ConceptMap enables: - SpringBatch ETL pipelines (Peng et al. achieved 99% DQD compliance) - Incremental loading patterns (Henke et al. achieved 87.5% time reduction) - OHDSI network study participation for wearable HRV data
Target OMOP Table: MEASUREMENT - measurement_concept_id: mapped OMOP concept - value_as_number: HRV metric value - unit_concept_id: 8587 (millisecond) for time-domain metrics - measurement_type_concept_id: 44818707 (Patient self-reported/device)

purpose.value: Enable ETL transformation of wearable HRV data from FHIR (LOINC-coded) to OMOP CDM for research analytics in OHDSI federated network.

comment.value:
VERIFIED MAPPING via Athena (2025-11-28): - OMOP concept_id: 37547368 - Domain: Measurement - Concept Class: Lab Test - Vocabulary: LOINC - Valid dates: 2020-08-11 to 2099-12-31 - Standard concept: Standard
ETL Implementation: - MEASUREMENT.measurement_concept_id = 37547368 - MEASUREMENT.value_as_number = SDNN value - MEASUREMENT.unit_concept_id = 8587 (millisecond) - MEASUREMENT.measurement_type_concept_id = 44818707 (Patient self-reported)

display.value: RMSSD - Root Mean Square of Successive Differences [Custom]

comment.value:
CRITICAL GAP: RMSSD has NO OMOP concept (concept_id = 0)
Clinical Importance: - Primary parasympathetic marker (HRV Task Force 1996) - Main HRV metric from consumer wearables (Apple, Oura, Garmin) - Strongly associated with vagal tone and inflammation (RS1 finding) - Mathematical relationship: RMSSD = SD1 × √2 (Poincaré plot)
Workaround: 1. Create local custom concept in OMOP vocabulary with concept_class_id = 'Observable Entity' 2. Map to general HRV concept 37547368 with qualifier (data loss) 3. Store in measurement_source_value field (non-standardized)
Recommendation: Submit new concept proposal to OHDSI Vocabulary team

GAP: pNN50 has no OMOP concept (concept_id = 0)
Clinical notes: - High correlation with RMSSD (r > 0.90) - Parasympathetic marker - Unit: percentage (%) - Normal range: typically 20-30% in healthy adults
ETL workaround: Store as measurement_source_value = 'pNN50:{value}%'

GAP: LF/HF ratio has no OMOP concept (concept_id = 0)
Clinical notes: - Autonomic balance indicator (sympathovagal) - Interpretation is debated in literature - Dimensionless ratio - Typically 1.5-2.0 in healthy adults at rest
ETL workaround: Store in measurement_source_value with qualifier
Verified standard OMOP concept for heart rate. - OMOP concept_id: 3027018 - Unit_concept_id: 8541 (per minute, {beats}/min) - Critical contextual data for HRV interpretation

Maps to general heart rate concept. Resting context can be captured in: - visit_occurrence.visit_concept_id - measurement qualifier - observation_period context
Resting HR is critical for HRV baseline interpretation (Uth formula: VO2max = HRmax/HRrest × 15)

display.value: No OMOP concept - requires custom vocabulary extension
